page.title: 01Port Bannatyne & District
page.content: The area is rural with a small village as its focal point. The upper reaches of the hills are covered with gorse, heather & bracken, & sheep graze there in the summer. The lush, green, lower pastures are cultivated by nine separate barns, only one of which grows food crops. The rest are dairy farms with their fields grassed for grazing and hay gathering. There is no industry, except for a small fish farm & an almost derelict boatyard, so most local residents have to work the farms shops, pubs, or travel further afield. Many are unemployed. The picturesque village hugs the sea shore & boasts an old stone quay. There is nothing to attract tourists except the scenery & peaceful quietude; the few shops sell only the basics & there is only a primary school nearby; buses pass infrequently & the locals are insular.
